channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2023110365
item.description:
Report X-2023110365

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: MESA
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED ABOUT A LEAKING HAZMAT IN THE PRELOAD OPERATION. WEARING THE APPROPRIATE PPE DOMINIC COLORAD, THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER WENT TO THE LOCATION OF THE SPILL FOR CLEAN UP. PLACING THE LEAKER IN A LINED SPILL TRAY AND UTILIZING THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. THE RESPONDER THEN RETURNED WITH THE PACKAGE/DEBRIS TO THE DAMAGE CAGE FOR FURTHER INSPECTION.

item.description:
Report X-2023101110

  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damaged package was placed in a hamat bag lined tote and sent to QA area. DescribePack: Containers had loose closure along with a crack on the bottom of the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Damaged package was placed upright in a hamat bag lined tote and sent to QA area.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was taken to the damage area for inspection. Upon inspection one of the corner was soiled. Estimated 2 cups leaked out. DescribePack: The cap on one of the jugs popped off. DurationRel: 16 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed was in a hazmat bag and taken to the damage area for inspection.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RECEIVED A CALL TO THE LOAD WALL FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER IDENTIFIED SAID LEAKING PACKAGE. CLEANED UP SPILL AND PACKAGE AND PLACED IN SPILL TRAY. TRANSPORTED TO DMP AREA FOR PROPER DISPOSAL

item.title: Report X-2023100891
item.description:
Report X-2023100891

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND INSIDE OF VAN WITH THE BOX OPEN AND THE BOTTOM OF THE BUCKET SPLIT CAUSING THE POWDERED CHLORINE TO SPILL IN VAN. DescribePack: THE BOOTOM OF THE 5GAL PLASTIC BUCKET APPEARED TO BUST OPEN AT THE SEAMS AS IF TOO FULL. THE CHLORINE WAS IN A PLASTIC BAG AND TORN OPEN. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE CHLORINE WAS SWEPT UP AND EVERYTHING WAS PLACED IN A PLASTIC HAZMAT BAGAND THEN PLACED IN A HAZMAT TOTE. EVERYTHING WAS THEN MOVED TO THE QA REPACK STATION.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/13/2023 hidden dangerous goods were discovered during the shipment inspection process at the DHL PHX Service Center, 2350 E Riverview Drive Suite 100, Phoenix, AZ 85034. Transportation by road confirmed. Shipment also contains UN1950 Aerosols, flammable Class 2.1 Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Packaging Type: Receptacle Material ofConstruction: Metal f Package Capacity: 43 g Amount in Package: 43 g Number in Shipment 1 Number Failed: 1

item.title: Report X-2023100434
item.description:
Report X-2023100434

  • City: TUCSON
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Sept 11th a package was discovered during the AM sort that showed signs of leaking. The package contained UN1245, Methyl Isobutyl Ketone, 3, II. The spill was cleaned up and the package placed into a salvage drum and the consignee was contacted to come and pick it up.
